pullrequest.title: revert some pgs back to sor

content.raw: It's a good point... I have always thought of PGS as the core active *algorithm*, while SOR is a slight variant of the core PGS algorithm. But that's just my bias. We do actively use all cases of over-relaxation, no-relaxation and under-relaxation in simulations regularly, and SOR is only officially being applied when we are over-relaxing the solution (i.e. the \omega parameter is strictly larger than 1), but on the other hand, the underlying PGS is always active. My preference is to keep the SOR-conecpt as a parameter to PGS.
content.html: It's a good point... I have always thought of PGS as the core active algorithm, while SOR is a slight variant of the core PGS algorithm. But that's just my bias. We do actively use all cases of over-relaxation, no-relaxation and under-relaxation in simulations regularly, and SOR is only officially being applied when we are over-relaxing the solution (i.e. the \omega parameter is strictly larger than 1), but on the other hand, the underlying PGS is always active. My preference is to keep the SOR-conecpt as a parameter to PGS.
